oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The potential for slug control with ferric phosphate
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Horgan, A R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Farm nutrient management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Slug and snail damage, especially on young plants can mean serious economic loss for growers. Organic growers have in the past had few, if any, effective products to use for their control. Now ferric phosphate has recently gained organic status from the Organic Farmers and Growers organisation. Its unique mode of action, environmental profile and effectiveness against a range of slug and snail species will make this a first choice for all organic growers. The eventual breakdown components iron and phosphate, will contribute to the cropâ€™s nutrient supply.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Horgan, A R (2006) The potential for slug control with ferric phosphate. In: Atkinson, C; Ball, B; Davies, D H K; Rees, R; Russell, G; Stockdale, E A; Watson, C A; Walker, R and Younie, D (Eds.) Aspects of Applied Biology 79, What will organic farming deliver? COR 2006, Association of Applied Biologists, pp. 225-226.
